revised_title: Observations of Aurora Australis Phenomenon in 1739
tldr: In 1739, Cromwell Mortimer observed an Aurora Australis event in London. He described the appearance of a bright column of light with a uniform steady color, which sometimes vanished and reappeared. He also noticed three pyramids of light with a sea-green color emerging from clouds in the north-northwest. This observation contributed to the understanding of atmospheric and geomagnetic phenomena.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
